title: Nepal Teen, Youngest To Scale 14 Tallest Peaks, Says Sherpas Deserve Better
content: A Nepali teenager, the youngest person ever to scale all 14 of the world's tallest peaks, says he wants to use his skills to benefit the Himalayan nation's Sherpa community and turn out world-class athletes.
summary: A Nepali teenager, the youngest person ever to scale all 14 of the world's tallest peaks, says he wants to use his skills to benefit the Himalayan nation's Sherpa community and turn out world-class athletes.

title: Big Finding On Fruit Flies Could be Key to Human Longevity: Study
content: The gut could be key to understanding longevity, according to a study that found a gut hormone in fruit flies could control lifespan, a result important to humans as both species have many similar genes and hormones.
summary: The gut could be key to understanding longevity, according to a study that found a gut hormone in fruit flies could control lifespan, a result important to humans as both species have many similar genes and hormones.

title: Hamas Chief And "Mass Murderer" Yahya Sinwar Eliminated: Israel
content: Israel said Thursday its forces killed Hamas chief Yahya Sinwar in a Gaza operation, dealing a massive blow to the group it has been fighting since the October 7, 2023 attack.
summary: Israel said Thursday its forces killed Hamas chief Yahya Sinwar in a Gaza operation, dealing a massive blow to the group it has been fighting since the October 7, 2023 attack.

title: Africa Reports 1,100 Mpox Deaths, Warns Outbreak Is "Out Of Control"
content: Some 1,100 people across Africa have died from mpox, the African Union's health agency said Thursday, warning that the epidemic was "going out of control" without further action.
summary: Some 1,100 people across Africa have died from mpox, the African Union's health agency said Thursday, warning that the epidemic was "going out of control" without further action.

title: UK Scrambled Typhoon Jet To Intercept Air India Flight After Bomb Threat
content: The Royal Air Force on Thursday scrambled a Typhoon fighter jet to intercept an Air India aircraft that received a bomb threat and the plane later landed safely in London.
summary: The Royal Air Force on Thursday scrambled a Typhoon fighter jet to intercept an Air India aircraft that received a bomb threat and the plane later landed safely in London.

title: Russia To Deploy 10,000 North Korean Troops Against Ukraine, Claims Zelensky
content: Russia is preparing to deploy 10,000 North Korean soldiers in the fight against Kyiv, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Thursday, citing intelligence information.
summary: Russia is preparing to deploy 10,000 North Korean soldiers in the fight against Kyiv, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Thursday, citing intelligence information.

title: Before Liam Payne's Death, Call To Cops From Hotel Warned Of "Life At Risk"
content: Pop star Liam Payne, who shot to global fame with boy band One Direction, died at the age of 31 after falling from a third-floor hotel room balcony in Buenos Aires, Argentina, triggering an outpouring of tributes from fans around the world.
summary: Pop star Liam Payne, who shot to global fame with boy band One Direction, died at the age of 31 after falling from a third-floor hotel room balcony in Buenos Aires, Argentina, triggering an outpouring of tributes from fans around the world.

title: All About Yahya Sinwar: Hamas Chief Who Was Committed To Eradicating Israel
content: Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar remains unrepentant about the October 7 attacks a year ago, people in contact with him have said, despite unleashing an Israeli invasion that has killed tens of thousands of Palestinians, laid waste to his Gaza homeland and
summary: Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar remains unrepentant about the October 7 attacks a year ago, people in contact with him have said, despite unleashing an Israeli invasion that has killed tens of thousands of Palestinians, laid waste to his Gaza homeland and

title: Hamas Leader Yahya Sinwar Likely Killed In Gaza Strike, Claims Israel
content: Israeli ministers have been informed that Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar has very likely been killed by Israeli troops who were conducting an operation in southern Gaza, two officials with knowledge of the situation said.
summary: Israeli ministers have been informed that Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar has very likely been killed by Israeli troops who were conducting an operation in southern Gaza, two officials with knowledge of the situation said.

title: India-Canada Ties Hit Record Low, All You Need To Know About Justin Trudeau
content: This diplomatic row stems from Justin Trudeau's earlier accusations linking Indian agents to the 2023 murder of Khalistani leader Hardeep Singh Nijjar
summary: This diplomatic row stems from Justin Trudeau's earlier accusations linking Indian agents to the 2023 murder of Khalistani leader Hardeep Singh Nijjar

title: "God's Problem Now": US Man's Hilarious Obituary For His Father Goes Viral
content: An obituary for a 74-year-old US man who died after falling and hitting his head has gone viral, with his son letting the public know that he is "God's problem now".
summary: An obituary for a 74-year-old US man who died after falling and hitting his head has gone viral, with his son letting the public know that he is "God's problem now".

title: Air India Mumbai-London Flight Gets Bomb Threat An Hour Before Landing
content: An Air India flight from Mumbai to London declared an emergency onboard after receiving a bomb threat.
summary: An Air India flight from Mumbai to London declared an emergency onboard after receiving a bomb threat.

title: 28 Killed After Israeli Strike Hits School, Says Gaza Ministry
content: At least 19 Palestinians including children were killed on Thursday after an Israeli strike hit a school in Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip that is sheltering displaced people, a Gaza health ministry official told Reuters.
summary: At least 19 Palestinians including children were killed on Thursday after an Israeli strike hit a school in Jabalia in the northern Gaza Strip that is sheltering displaced people, a Gaza health ministry official told Reuters.

title: Man Named In Terrorist Pannun Case No Longer Government Employee: India
content: India has confirmed the US' assertion that a person identified as 'CC1' in a US Department of Justice indictment on an alleged assassination plot of Khalistani terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun is no longer employed by the Indian government.
summary: India has confirmed the US' assertion that a person identified as 'CC1' in a US Department of Justice indictment on an alleged assassination plot of Khalistani terrorist Gurpatwant Singh Pannun is no longer employed by the Indian government.

title: Israel Halts Key Commercial Food Imports To Gaza: Report
content: Israel has stopped processing requests from traders to import food to Gaza, according to 12 people involved in the trade, choking off a track that for the past six months supplied more than half of the besieged Palestinian territory's provisions.
summary: Israel has stopped processing requests from traders to import food to Gaza, according to 12 people involved in the trade, choking off a track that for the past six months supplied more than half of the besieged Palestinian territory's provisions.

title: Nearly 100% Of Gaza Now Lives In Poverty, UN Sounds Alarm Over Unemployment
content: More than a year into Israel's war against Hamas, "nearly 100 per cent" of Gaza's population has been plunged into poverty with a ruined economy and "staggering" unemployment, the UN said today.
summary: More than a year into Israel's war against Hamas, "nearly 100 per cent" of Gaza's population has been plunged into poverty with a ruined economy and "staggering" unemployment, the UN said today.

title: "Wanted Canada To Extradite Bishnoi Gang Members": India On Diplomatic Row
content: In the backdrop of ongoing diplomatic tensions between India and Canada, India has raised concerns over Canada's handling of criminals linked to organised crime.
summary: In the backdrop of ongoing diplomatic tensions between India and Canada, India has raised concerns over Canada's handling of criminals linked to organised crime.

title: Meta Fires Employees For Using $25 Meal Credits On Toothpaste, Detergent
content: The misuse of these benefits, which included sending meals home when employees weren't in the office, resulted in a formal HR investigation and subsequent firings.
summary: The misuse of these benefits, which included sending meals home when employees weren't in the office, resulted in a formal HR investigation and subsequent firings.

title: Italy Makes It Illegal To Seek Surrogacy Abroad
content: Italy's parliament made it illegal on Wednesday for couples to go abroad to have a baby via surrogacy -- a pet project of Prime Minister's Giorgia Meloni party which activists say is meant to target same-sex partners.
summary: Italy's parliament made it illegal on Wednesday for couples to go abroad to have a baby via surrogacy -- a pet project of Prime Minister's Giorgia Meloni party which activists say is meant to target same-sex partners.

title: "Massive Door" Spotted In Antarctica Sparks Theories. What Scientists Say
content: Eagle-eyed users on Reddit first spotted the mysterious structure on Google Maps at the coordinates 69°00’50″S 39°36’22″E.
summary: Eagle-eyed users on Reddit first spotted the mysterious structure on Google Maps at the coordinates 69°00’50″S 39°36’22″E.
